title: How to Blind Stitch

steps.headline: Get the materials.
steps.description: Thread a long, thin sewing needle with thread  matching the material you are going to sew.

steps.headline: Secure the thread end.
steps.description: Knot one end of the thread.

steps.headline: Prepare the fabric.
steps.description: Iron the material fold to crease it if necessary. For example: with hems, or edges of applique.

steps.headline: Prepare the fabric.
steps.description: Position the fabrics and pin them in place.

steps.headline: Begin sewing.
steps.description: Slide the needle into the material from the back side to attach the thread to the material. The thread knot will hold in the material after the needle has been pulled through.

steps.headline: Make even stitches.
steps.description:
Start by making long stitches in one piece of fabric and tiny stitches in the other. Carefully position the needle points of exit or entry into the fabric to make the hemming thread appear invisible.
